column4: doesnt do that for me, on any distributions with 2.6.22 and higher
Then we need to figure out where the cutoff is...  I have feisty on this box.
they made changes 2.6.22 and above all required to have uuid for id, but if you format a partition its uuid changes along with the swap partitions if you install a distro on it.
its a pain in the butt but someone figured that was needed, probably the man himself.
UUID ic calculated using the size and location and other info...
Where did you see that it is not that way since that version of kernal
i watched it change, I use sidux and kanotix, sidux dealt with it back in jan 2007
I was looking for a wiki or some other solid info...
i have no problem with it, i just get the new uuid with ls -l /dev/disk/by-uuid and make change to my fstab as needed.
Agreed .. it is easy to fix fstab...   but that page I linked is dated oct 07 and still shows that uuid's change based on size and location of the partition on the drive.
commenting out the uuid is a bad idea as when the kernel gets changed they rely on uuids
I never suggested commenting out the uuid.. that page does... but I personally like them...
i think it might pertain more to Ubuntu than other debian distros
yes , they are a pain but needed. everyone has an opinion on uuid's and its likely to be around a long time. i work with them as needed.

The only point of contention was.. do that all change when you change one...   I understand that uuid's change for all partitions on the drive past from the partition you change to the last partition on that drive

well, on sidux and kanotix i can say that only the partition that is formated and the swap but thats when you install a new distro on it. The others remain the same and don't change, and using ls -l /dev/disk/by-uuid will show that.
